intro: Pseudotrachydium, commonly known as the false trachydium, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its herbaceous growth habit and distinctive, palmately lobed leaves. The flowers are typically small and clustered in inflorescences, often with five petals. The genus includes several species that are native to regions in Africa and the Americas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Pseudotrachydium is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
